citation.abstract: While mass spectrometry (MS) is a powerful tool for biomarker determinations, the high salt content and the small molecules present in urine poses incredible challenges. Separation/extraction methods must be employed for the isolation of target species at relevant concentrations. Micropipette tips packed with capillary-channeled polymer (C-CP) fibers are employed for the solid phase extraction of proteins from a synthetic and a certified urine matrix.
citation.title: Capillary‐channeled polymer (C‐CP) fibers for the rapid extraction of proteins from urine matrices prior to detection with MALDI‐MS

news.title: Proteins in urine: Capillary channels in polymer fibres for micro-SPE
news.summary: Polymer fibres with inbuilt channels have been used for the extraction of proteins from urine by solid-phase extraction in a rapid and inexpensive preparation for mass spectrometric analysis.

news.title: New urine test could reduce need for blood samples
news.summary: If you've been to the doctor, you probably know what to do when you're handed a plastic cup and shown to the bathroom.

news.title: New urine test may lessen need to draw blood
news.summary: By finding a way to isolate the protein biomarkers of disease in urine, researchers have devised a potentially faster, cheaper test that could reduce the need for blood samples.
